attorney_orgs: U.S. Dept. of Justice Civil Rights Division
issues: General/Misc., Reproductive rights, Environmental Justice and Resources: Funding

docket_entries.description: Case assigned to Honorable Edward C. Prado (wg) (Entered: 10/18/1995)

STIPULATED JUDGMENT for United States against Security S.B. Pecos in the sum of $500,000, to be distributed as contained in said Judgment. Within 30 days after entry of this Stipulated Judgment, Defendant shall pay $10,000 by check payable to the USA as a civil money penalty. This action is DISMISSED without prejudice to the right of either party to approach the Court regarding matters of noncompliance with the terms of this Judgment. Each party to this litigation will bear its own costs. (fe) (Entered: 10/18/1995)

case_data.name: United States v. Security State Bank of Pecos
case_data.plaintiff_description: United States Department of Justice Housing and Civil Enforcement Section
case_data.summary:
The Department of Justice filed suit against Defendant-lender in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas on October 18, 1995, alleging violations of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1691-1691f. The District Court entered a stipulated judgment the same day, assessing a $500,000 penalty against the Defendant-lender and a $10,000 fine.

We have no other information about this case.
